page.title: 13ST JOHN THE BAPTIST CHURCH
page.content: The church of St.John the Baptist, Murton-cum-Hilton was built in 1856. Of particular interest is the three-decker pulpit and some fine oil lamps. St John's is the one place of religious worship, attached to the parish of St.Lawrence's, Appleby (Church of England), and sharing the same vicar. Roman Catholics and Methodists must travel to Appleby for regular church services. The church here has a flourishing Sunday School. Like most places of worship the upkeep is a financial headache, and in 1984 the parishioners had a most successful Flower Festival to raise extra funds.
